title: Lamb korma

ingredients.content: 2 brown onions (approx. 300 g), cut into halves
1 tsp sea salt, plus extra to taste
1000 g boneless lamb shoulder, cut into cubes (3-4 cm)
150 g natural yoghurt, plus extra to serve
fresh coriander, leaves only, to serve

preparations.content: Place 1 of the onions, ginger, garlic, coriander, cumin, cardamom, salt and chilli into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer marinade into a large bowl.
Place lamb pieces into large bowl with marinade and coat lamb pieces then set aside in the refrigerator to marinate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Place remaining onion and ghee or olive oil into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add marinated lamb and cook <b>7 min/120°C//speed <b>, placing simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid.
Add tomato paste, garam masala and yoghurt and cook <b>99 min/90°C//speed <b>, placing simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid.
Adjust seasoning to taste before serving with cooked rice, a spoonful of yoghurt and fresh coriander leaves.

hintsAndTricks: Serve Korma with Naan bread and condiments of choice.
To make your own Garam masala, please refer to the recipe in The Basic Cookbook.
